title.value: Maintenance Cost of Software Ecosystem Updates
title.justification: The title is clearly mentioned in the beginning of the document as: "Maintenance Cost of Software Ecosystem Updates".
title.quote: Maintenance Cost of Software Ecosystem Updates

extractions.description: This paper discusses the challenges and costs associated with maintaining software ecosystems, particularly in the context of frequent updates in Industry 4.0 domains. It introduces a model to quantify these maintenance costs based on software release metadata and evaluates it through case studies.

type.justification: The paper is mainly focused on proposing a model and theoretical framework for understanding and calculating maintenance costs in software ecosystems using release metadata.
type.quote: This paper proposes to leverage public software release metadata...model a software ecosystem and its maintenance cost.

name.justification: The paper discusses aspects of software maintenance, updates, and ecosystem management, which are core topics within Software Engineering.
name.quote: Over the past decades, software domains have witnessed...

name.justification: The paper frequently mentions applications and implications within Industry 4.0 domains.
name.quote: Examples include products in Industry 4.0 domains such as health care, retail, or mobility.

name.justification: The paper proposes a graph-based model to represent software ecosystems.
name.quote: This section details the definition of a graph-based software ecosystem model.

name.justification: The paper presents a model to calculate the maintenance cost of software ecosystems using a graph-based approach.
name.quote: This section details the definition of a graph-based software ecosystem model as well as the definition of the main- tenance cost.

is_contributed.justification: The model is a contribution of the paper to quantify software ecosystem maintenance costs.
is_contributed.quote: This paper proposes to leverage public software release metadata...to model a software ecosystem.

is_executed.justification: The paper describes the use of this model in case studies within the paper, indicating its execution.
is_executed.quote: The model is kept generic...and evaluated in three Industry 4.0 use cases.

is_compared.justification: The paper does not mention a direct comparison with other models for maintenance cost.
is_compared.quote: In contrast to the work herein, their research is focused...

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not reference another specific paper for this model.
